body_html:
It appears that this is failing because the program to generate the header and source files for the math operations is failing. It's hard to say why this is happening, but it appears you're running an old Linux distribution (I believe RedHat 4.8 is from 2009), which may have various shared libraries (such as libc) or tools (gcc versions) that are not compatible with the source tree.

Perhaps you can debug the failing command:

bazel-out/host/bin/tensorflow/cc/ops/math_ops_gen_cc \
  bazel-out/local-opt/genfiles/tensorflow/cc/ops/math_ops.h \
  bazel-out/local-opt/genfiles/tensorflow/cc/ops/math_ops.cc \
  tensorflow/cc/ops/op_gen_overrides.pbtxt 0

to figure out what is causing it to segfault.

Unfortunately, we don't have the bandwidth to debug installation on the Linux distribution you're having trouble with. Officially, only Ubuntu is supported as per https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources and we rely on community support for other distributions.

body:
It appears that this is failing because the program to generate the header and source files for the math operations is failing. It's hard to say why this is happening, but it appears you're running an old Linux distribution (I believe RedHat 4.8 is from 2009), which may have various shared libraries (such as `libc`) or tools (`gcc` versions) that are not compatible with the source tree.

Perhaps you can debug the failing command:

```
bazel-out/host/bin/tensorflow/cc/ops/math_ops_gen_cc \
  bazel-out/local-opt/genfiles/tensorflow/cc/ops/math_ops.h \
  bazel-out/local-opt/genfiles/tensorflow/cc/ops/math_ops.cc \
  tensorflow/cc/ops/op_gen_overrides.pbtxt 0
```

to figure out what is causing it to segfault. 

Unfortunately, we don't have the bandwidth to debug installation on the Linux distribution you're having trouble with. Officially, only Ubuntu is supported as per https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources and we rely on community support for other distributions.
